ca.cwfgm.psaas.api.solar

Class SolarCalculator

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.cwfgm.psaas.api.solar.SolarCalculator

  • public abstract class SolarCalculator
extends Object
    Calculate sunrise, sunset, and solar noon.

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      abstract void calculate()
      Get the sunrise, sunset and solar noon.
      int getDay()
      The day of the month to get the sunrise/sunset for.
      double getLatitude()
      The latitude to calculate the sunrise/sunset for (in degrees).

      The year to get the sunset/sunrise for.

      • getLatitude

        public double getLatitude()
        The latitude to calculate the sunrise/sunset for (in degrees).

      • setLatitude

        public void setLatitude(double latitude)
        Set the latitude to calculate the sunrsie/sunset for (in degrees).

      • getLongitude

        public double getLongitude()
        The longitude to calculate the sunrise/sunset for (in degrees).

      • setLongitude

        public void setLongitude(double longitude)
        Set the longitude to calculate the sunrise/sunset for (in degrees).

      • getTimezone

        public int getTimezone()
        The timezone index to format the returned forecast times in. Will be an index into the list returned by Timezone.getTimezoneNameList().

      • setTimezone

        public void setTimezone(int timezone)
        Set the timezone to format the returned forecast times in. Must be from the list obtained from Timezone.getTimezoneNameList().

      • getYear

        public int getYear()
        The year to get the sunset/sunrise for.

      • getMonth

        public int getMonth()
        The month to get the sunset/sunrise for. January - 1 to December - 12

      • getDay

        public int getDay()
        The day of the month to get the sunrise/sunset for.

      • setDate

        public void setDate(int year,
                    int month,
                    int day)
        Set the date to calculate the sunrise/sunset time for.
        Parameters:
        year - The year to calculate for. Must be after 1600.
        month - The month to calculate for. January - 1 to December - 12
        day - The day of the month to calculate for. The range will depend on the month and year.

      • getSunrise

        public String getSunrise()
        Sunrise in the same timezone as the input.

      • getSunset

        public String getSunset()
        Sunset in the same timezone as the input.

      • getSolarNoon

        public String getSolarNoon()
        Solar noon in the same timezone as the intput.

      • calculate

        public abstract void calculate()
                        throws IOException
        Get the sunrise, sunset and solar noon.
        Throws:
        IOException
